number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 28, 2014
												This game is absolutely amazing. This is a prime example of how a DLC is done the right way. For the same price this game is asking you could get four multiplayer maps in Ghosts (which should come with the game free of charge, but whatever), and Blood Dragon doesn't require the main game, making it that much better. I cannot praise this game enough. The soundtrack is perfect, and I want it for my Steam music player. The visuals are incredible, matching the soundtrack in every way. The cut scenes are skippable (press Enter then Escape), but you shouldn't skip them because they're awesome. The amount of references to 80's movies and pop culture are incredible, adding to the aesthetics of the game. The final boss battle is also something everyone should experience at one point in their life. To be honest I haven't had a problem with Uplay yet, so I don't see what the big deal is. The most you'll have to deal with it is setting up an account, but that doesn't take too long. Long story short this game is awesome.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 9, 2014
												First off, this game is attached to Ubisoft UPlay. If you do not like that fact that you have to have a separate account to maintain the list then you should avoid this game.  It is very difficult to move licenses of Ubisoft games to new profiles that you may have created with other games if you have ignored the registration process. It takes a while for Ubisoft Support to process claims for this....Onto the review:Blood Dragon is a standalone version of what Far Cry 3 is. It's more compact version of what Far Cry 3 is.  Even if you don't want to commit to playing Far Cry 3 with all the content that it has then you can get a relative feel of the experience through Blood Dragon.  Regardless of what you choose, you will enjoy these iterations of Far Cry.Blood Dragon is an over the top game that borrows on futuristic visionary concepts from the 80s: Neon lights, dramatic music and acting cliches.  Players will notice this through the weaponry, vistas, and character tropes. Gameplay wise, it's generic: find stuff, recover stuff, do missions and save the day.  Just remember to take it all in stride.

content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
												I finally got this game running.  It won't even start on my desktop, but it ended up working on my older laptop.  The concept could work, but unfortunately this is still Far Cry 3.  Clunky controls and movement, which is incredibly distracting.  And you run around collecting enemy cyber-hearts.  This is supposed to be a shooter, not a collection game!  How could the developer possibly think it is fun to stop for two seconds to collect a heart from every single kill?  It breaks up the gameplay in the worst possible way.  This is my beef with all Ubisoft games.  They don't bother to play their games to see if they're actually fun or not.  Ugh.

number of helpful: 5 of 10 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 29, 2014
												If Steam would have a points score system, i would give it 5 or 6 maybe. So i should give it a negative review. It's an ok game, but after playing this i know i don't want to play any of the other Far Cries (and i haven't). It is bland and repetitive. Story missions and the theme is ok, but nothing really engaging, spectacular, at times stupid even. I get that this was an intention to beat on trash movies cliches, but it was too much some times. Outside of the main story it is an open world which is pretty empty. Yeah with some fights between scientists and commandos going on here and there. It was fun to roam in a jeep, but not for long. Side quest are all similar (go and kill someone and maybe save some scientist jerk). I hated missions requiring you to do stealth in an open field surrounded by 20+ enemies. "Cutscenes" were often too long and, i don't know, i just didn't liked how they sounded and looked. I didn't get the leveling thing as you couldn't choose a skill, it was just a linear progression which happened automatically. I hated some animations like pilfering cyberhearts (which you needed sometimes to distract dragons) or shotgun reloading cycle which took to long to start shooting again.Then the general design. Saves somethimes weren't working. So i ended up only using checkpoints. And once i had to listen to some story dialog like 10 times while dying on some side quest and loading again. Stupid system of repeating everything when you load a save. After a recent uPlay update it started to mess with Blood Dragon launch and jumped in front of it making BD starting in a windowed state, so i had to restart it every time (that' because uPlay wasn't already running, yeah, i don't want some program to run all the time when i only need it for one game occasionally). That's another point why i won't play Far Cry or other Ubisoft game.All in all, it was fun to shoot enemies and ride the jeep at times, but it was also a bland, sometimes boring game with an overdone humour. Can't call it a good game.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 12, 2016
												There is nothing about this game you shouldn't love. This game... this game is designed for you to play as you want to. Assuming that you played far cry 3, obviously, but that's why it's in the title.You want to just mow through the missions and kick♥♥♥♥♥ You can do that. You want to go around collecting random♥♥♥♥♥♥and conquering a bunch of random outposts just because the game has them? You can do that. This game.... This game lets you do both. You don't -need- to follow either path, because... this game.... it gives you freedom. The freedom you need.Anyway, if you choose to follow the missions only, you'll find an experience on non-stop hilarity and action. If you don't like the extreeeeme, you won't like this game, but if you think you can stomach it... this game is for you.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 1, 2015
												I just finished this game and I have to say, great ending. Saying it for you would just ruin the surprise. This has been literally the funniest video game that I have ever played. Also the funnest. The things that just about every part of the game says is hilarious. Every description of a weapon to the bio of a character to the random stuff that Rex says. The corny badass phrases the are said in this game make me feel like I'm some funny, non Schwarzinegger, terminator with a good sense of humor. This 80's terminator universe is big enough to call this a small game instead of a DLC. Well worth the money to play this fantastic piece of entertainment. I had a lot of fun playing through this and I don't think there's many people out there wouldn't. If your reading this considering whether to get this game, just get it. It's so much fun. The art style is very pretty, and doesn't take as much computer power to put out great looking graphics.Probably my new favorite title to date.Pros: Hilarious80's throwbackGreat GraphicsGood storyCool Weapons(especially the arm lazer)Overall sarcasticnessCons:There are none. Period.I think the reason this came to be is because ubisoft handed out 6 packs in the office one day and everyone got good and buzzed before they did some brainstorming. I have to hand it to them. This is about as far from far cry 3 as they could have gotten and they did it spectatularly well.My favorite part of this game is sneaking into a garrison, turning off the shields, throwing a cyber heart in the middle and watching the blood dragon reak havok on the soldiers with lazer vision. There is actually a part in this game where you play ring around the rosy with a blood dragon mama that you just killed all the babies of until you can escape on the elavator. Scared the heck out of me when I saw it running my way.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2015
												The perfect microcosm of an open-world title, wrapped up in what is one of the better 80s action movie parodies I've ever seen. Seriously, beat for beat it's amazing. I'm incredibly sad more studios don't use completed engines for short projects like this more often, it's leaving cash on the table. I don't even want to describe why it's so good, because between the game's brief length and the jam-packed amount of jokes in there, I feel like it should just be experienced instead of explained.Buy this, and then watch it whip itself out and take a leak all over the rest of the genre's conventions.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 9, 2014
												First off, this game is attached to Ubisoft UPlay. If you do not like that fact that you have to have a separate account to maintain the list then you should avoid this game.  It is very difficult to move licenses of Ubisoft games to new profiles that you may have created with other games if you have ignored the registration process. It takes a while for Ubisoft Support to process claims for this....Onto the review:Blood Dragon is a standalone version of what Far Cry 3 is. It's more compact version of what Far Cry 3 is.  Even if you don't want to commit to playing Far Cry 3 with all the content that it has then you can get a relative feel of the experience through Blood Dragon.  Regardless of what you choose, you will enjoy these iterations of Far Cry.Blood Dragon is an over the top game that borrows on futuristic visionary concepts from the 80s: Neon lights, dramatic music and acting cliches.  Players will notice this through the weaponry, vistas, and character tropes. Gameplay wise, it's generic: find stuff, recover stuff, do missions and save the day.  Just remember to take it all in stride.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 23, 2014
												Far Cry 3 - Blood Dragon, where do I start? First thing's first - if you like Far Cry 3, you're wrong and you've never played Blood Dragon. Now that that's out of the way, lets get deeper into the game. This game definately gives Far Cry 3 a new look and it refines Far Cry 3 in a nutshell. Although this game is ♥♥♥♥ing AWESOME, you're required to install Uplay, which is a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ steam knockoff made for Ubisoft games. Other than that, this game is virtually flawless.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 3, 2014
												This is going to be tough to recommend this game. I dont want to give it a "thumbs down" because the game is usually on sale or at least offered at a reduced price. So, my only recommendation is really based on purchasing the game for equal or less than what I paid for the game. That price was $11.99What can go wrong? Far Cry 3: great map, solid game play, good AI, great environment, the whole nine yards. So, if the developers mod the game, reskin it, give it post 80's futuristic feel, add neon dinosaurs, and you should have a winner. But sadly, its immediately apparent that everyone involved took everything too far and everything was overdone. Its almost as if they used a overkill policy just to make sure they didnt miss their mark. If the goal was to create a nostalgic retro futuristic shooter off the FC3 platform they not only hit that target but they actually nuked it.The redeeming qualities of this game are all of the same qualities in Far Cry 3. All of the gun play and melee are the same. The map is the same. The animals are basically the same (except a few large T-Rexes).Im not going to get into to explaining the story line or the main character too much. Its not important. You have one bionic arm and your guy flips people off, has reload animations that are 80's ridiculous, and the jokes and comments will make you smirk for the first 5 mins before becoming very annoying. Your standard bad guys have digital sounding voices that also get very annoying after a few minutes. But as in FC3, those bad guys also said much of the same things too and were almost as annoying. I think the beautiful environment in FC3 distracted me enough to not have to pay too much attention to what the bad guys were saying. But in FC3-Blood Dragon, the whole world is dark and the excessive neon doesnt distract. Matter of fact, your brain starts to block it out after a few minutes and then youre left in this permanently dark world.So, it sounds like I hate the game, right? Well, kinda-sorta. But not really. All of the preview videos are fair. They show you exactly what you are getting; bad jokes, dark environment with neon, robots, and neon 1/2 robot dinosaurs. I purchased the game after finishing FC3. I wanted to continue playing the game and I did not want to actually replay the same story. So I got exactly what the previews showed me. However...I only played the game for about 1.5-2 hours before getting bored with it. At that point, I bought Far Cry 2 and enjoyed that immensely. So, if youre like me and finished Far Cry 3 and are still craving a Far Cry adventure, get FC2 if you havent played it yet...its great. But if you want neon dinosaurs then Blood Dragon is for you. It is worth the 11.99 USD that I paid for it, I dont regret that. And I feel like I got my money's worth. So at that price or less and this is a safe buy. Even if you only get 2 hrs out of it like I did, its the same amount of $ to go see a 2 hr movie. Dollars to Donuts

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 8, 2015
												This is a real short experience. Open World (not as big as FC3) with 2 hours of story elements. But every second is an enjoyment. This game made me buy Far Cry 3. It has the length of an 80s movie. And in fact it is an 80s/90s movie. (Open World Content will be like 5-20+ hours of collectibles, secrets and free roaming, while you can reset Enemy Garrisons now to have a neverending FPS Experience.)This game feels like "Escape from New York" (Escape from LA). This game is for people, who love Kung Fury, Terminator, Robocop, Ninja Turtles, Escape from New York, the Metal Gear Solid-Games, every Trash-Cyborg-Movie and Synthesizer-Pop-Music.The Engine is smooth and optimized. (The Far Cry 3 Franchise uses a strong amount of "Head-bobbing". This leads to some People who cannot play and enjoy these games.)Gameplay and Story are fantastic. Though the only stealthy Weapons here are the Neon-Bow and the Pink Tanto combined with the Laser-Shuriken. Besides that Stealth is fantastic in this game. Rating: 12/10 minus Uplay and the usual Far Cry 3 Headbobbing = 09/10A solid Shooter with outstanding Atmosphere and an interesting visual Style - if you get all the 80s/90s references.

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 28, 2013
												Now that the problem with Farcry 3 blood dragon has been fixed I still dont recommened if. For me he ammount of time needed to fix it; compared to the ammount of time it took to finish was just stupid. amount 2-3 months of forum searching for a 3 hour campaign.Old reviewWARNING UPLAY DOES NOT WORK. So I have been unable to play this game at all, regardless of what Steam is saying. The splash screen crash has existed since May 2013 (today's date is 18th January 2014). The splash screen crash has effected other titles on the UPLAY "service" (Assasins Creed III + IV, along with normal Far Cry 3). The forums do have some solutions to the problems; however these do not work for me. The people who managed to get through to Ubi support are saying that Ubi was unable to help them solve the problem; most people aren't even getting a response from Ubi (myself included). The guaranted solution amongst the forums is to; buy the game, then torrent the DRM free version of the game, followed by enjoyment. THIS IS NOT HOW IT SHOULD WORK. Torrented versions should not be SUPPERIOR to the retail copy that we PAID for with MONEY.

												Now that the problem with Farcry 3 blood dragon has been fixed I still dont recommened if. For me he ammount of time needed to fix it; compared to the ammount of time it took to finish was just stupid. amount 2-3 months of forum searching for a 3 hour campaign.Old reviewWARNING UPLAY DOES NOT WORK. So I have been unable to play this game at all, regardless of what Steam is saying. The splash screen crash has existed since May 2013 (today's date is 18th January 2014). The splash screen crash has effected other titles on the UPLAY "service" (Assasins Creed III + IV, along with normal Far Cry 3). The forums do have some solutions to the problems; however these do not work for me. The people who managed to get through to Ubi support are saying that Ubi was unable to help them solve the problem; most people aren't even getting a response from Ubi (myself included). The guaranted solution amongst the forums is to; buy the game, then torrent the DRM free version of the game, followed by enjoyment. THIS IS NOT HOW IT SHOULD WORK. Torrented versions should not be SUPPERIOR to the retail copy that we PAID for with MONEY.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 16, 2013
												Take the world of Far Cry 3, replace it by a 80s cheesy saturday morning cartoon post-apocalyptic universe that doesn't take itself seriously, that frequently breaks the fourth wall and mocks it, add an awesome 80s soundtrack by Power Glove, and a ton of other fun gimmicks... and you've got Blood Dragon.Only two complaints with this game: it's short (but well, it's a cheaply-priced spinoff made for the hell of it), and the cutscenes are mostly static images sliding around. But beyond that, the production value of this game is definitely AAA... and I would not mind seeing some sort of sequel to this game, because it's a bit of a transgression towards the traditional triple-A manshooter values that needs to happen more often.

content:
Posted: January 23, 2015
												Divertidissimo! A incrivel jogabilidade de Far Cry 3, porém com um toque de humor. O game é mais curto que o FC3. Usa o mesmo motor do Far Cry 3, porém com várias particularidades. As missões são divertidissimas de fazer.Seja transportado diretamente para a visão de futuro que existia no limiar entre os anos 80 e 90. Muitas referências POP e de games dos anos 90. Um herói brucutu e clichês ao melhor estilo desta época. Obrigatório pra quem curtiu FC3, tem bom humor e foi criança nos anos 80.Recomendo! ;)

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 9, 2013
												I can't recommend this game enough! First of all it has the FC3 Engine which is freaking amazing. Second for me is the soundtrack. For me this game has the soundtrack of the year. To recreate how music would sound in 2007 from a 80's point of view. Giorgio Moroder would be proud if he would listen to this.Third must be the great tribute this game gives to the 80's. If its fashion, film and technology. This game is how people in the 80's thought the future would look like.If you a fan of Tron, The Black Hole, Blade Runner, Terminator,Aliens, Robocop. At least once in the game you will get a little hint that will remind you of these films. Just by starting of with the upbeat Terminator Music or the synthesizer  music that reminds you of Miami Vice and Tron. It has it all the one liners of our great 80's action heroes. The Neon lights. Kraftwerk-esque Music etc.The action in this game is really great, you can run around a open world island and kill everything than comes to near. You can be stealthy or just do it commando style.Drive around or take a jet ski. The weapons in this game are amazing and can all be upgraded. Just buy this game and enjoy. I haven't played Far Cry 3 but I can only imagine how awesome it must be. I really enjoy sci fi, so that's why I love this game.10/10

content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
												I had some pretty major problems with just running this game at first. It would freeze up at random times and just stop responding. That was fixed by changing from fullscreen to borderless. I have a Radeon R9 285 but I now understand that this issue is very common. If you have the same problem, don't run it in fullscreen. That option should just be removed for all of the problem it's caused. Anyway, once I finally got it running, it has turned out to be one of my favorite games ever. The '80's movie humor alone is worth the price. This game has caused me to literally howl with laughter at times. I wish Ubisoft would make a sequel to this game. It's much better than FC3.

content:
Posted: November 9, 2013
												I can't recommend this game enough! First of all it has the FC3 Engine which is freaking amazing. Second for me is the soundtrack. For me this game has the soundtrack of the year. To recreate how music would sound in 2007 from a 80's point of view. Giorgio Moroder would be proud if he would listen to this.Third must be the great tribute this game gives to the 80's. If its fashion, film and technology. This game is how people in the 80's thought the future would look like.If you a fan of Tron, The Black Hole, Blade Runner, Terminator,Aliens, Robocop. At least once in the game you will get a little hint that will remind you of these films. Just by starting of with the upbeat Terminator Music or the synthesizer  music that reminds you of Miami Vice and Tron. It has it all the one liners of our great 80's action heroes. The Neon lights. Kraftwerk-esque Music etc.The action in this game is really great, you can run around a open world island and kill everything than comes to near. You can be stealthy or just do it commando style.Drive around or take a jet ski. The weapons in this game are amazing and can all be upgraded. Just buy this game and enjoy. I haven't played Far Cry 3 but I can only imagine how awesome it must be. I really enjoy sci fi, so that's why I love this game.10/10

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 30, 2014
												Overall Score: 5/10My advice: Only get it if you're really into 80's style movies and need something to crave a Far Cry itch until 4.Genre: Action Adventure FPS, sandbox RPG.Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon puts me in a difficult position. I loved Far Cry 3, and thought the creative direction to incorporate cheesy 80's-style humor with retro gaming was a neat take. But like... when you're playing a game, and you find yourself having to purposefully push yourself to keep playing it? That's a bad sign.I'd give a plot synopsis, but really, there's not much more to it then "you're a badass cyborg on an island killing pretty much everything while you save the world for the USA." If the humor the game uses were enough to make up for the flat plot, this might be exclusable, but there were countless groaners that really fit the genre... too well. Guys, there's a reason we don't right corny as hell plots like this anymore.Alright, so the story is flat and schlocky, how about the gameplay? Well, it's basically just Far Cry 3, except... detached. You've got maybe 6 hours in the core game, 16ish overall if you get all the collectables. They didn't add much new until really the end of the game, and really, half of what was so fun about Far Cry 3 was you ascended your character from weak chump to badass over the course of the game, discovering new skills and abilities. Here, you just start out a badass becoming a bigger badass, fighting hordes and hordes of bland, faceless enemies... It just kind of became boring. Vast murder and tons of explosions became boring. That's half the selling point of your game!The only stuff I really took enjoyment in was the stealth and the mobility, which is surpisingly good. The environments may not be all that pretty, but at least moving about them is a fluid and kinda pleasant experience.All in all, unless you really want some kind of new Far Cry 3 experience? Just avoid this one. I'm surprised I stuck with it as long as I did.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 18, 2013
												Blood Dragon is basically Far Cry 3 Lite: 80's Sci-fi Edition. Overwhelmingly tongue-in-cheek, and with a couple questionable design decisions here and there, but it's a very worthwhile entry in the field of open-world games that won't hit your wallet as hard as vanilla FC3.In particular I enjoy that you're given superhuman speed, unlimited sprint, and no fall damage right out of the gate. Traveling on foot is actually more efficient and reliable than ever bothering to jack a vehicle.

Apparently you need to finish the whole first level for the game to save your progress. I tried playing this game 3 times, every time from the beginning with those stupid unskippable shoot your weapon to kill enemies tutorials until I googled that the game dosen't save like normal games.. Now I have 69min playtime and zero progress.I cannot say much about the game, I just don't have the will to start the first level again for the fourth time with the tutorials and play it completely to find out if this game is good or not. If you are not sure you have enough time to always complete the whole level  don't buy this (I don't know if every level has the same "feature").We have come a long way when it comes to graphics from Doom and Wolfenstein3D, but taken many steps backwards when it comes to saving your game.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 12, 2013
												Just when you think this game can't get any more awesome, it does. From a dedicated flip-off button, to an insanely overpowered laser, to mechanical sharks, to cheesy one-liners and plot points from just about every 80's action movie you can think of; Blood Dragon is a great change of pace from the generic monotony of modern shooters.That being said, this game is easy... like really easy.I played through Far Cry 3 on normal and ended up having to challenge myself by not using stealth or certain weapons because it was so easy. With that in mind I played Blood Dragon on hard. Playing through this on hard felt easier than vanilla Far Cry 3 on normal. I was run and gunning almost the entire way through the game with little use of stealth and little to no threat of danger. Just one of the many perks of being a badass cyber commando I guess.Then there's the unfortunate fact that the game completely misses an opportunity to have a cheesy and completely unnecessary sex scene when Rex has too much energy for his body to handle. Luckily the game rectifies this by having an even cheesier sex scene about 2 minutes later.All-in-all, I give this game a 5 out of 5; Dangerously Cheesy.

content:
Posted: December 26, 2014
												This game was so overhyped and it came bundled with real Far Cry 3 (which is awesome btw) that after several "You have to play this!" from my friends I decided to give it a shot. TL;DR - The game isn't really good, but it has nothing to do with Uplay.Tell ya what, if you don't think you are going to love it after seeing the trailer - you won't. If that trailer was the thing for you - weeeeell, maybe you will kinda like the game. But still it is a watered-down, less-serious, brainless and rushed in version of FC3. It screames "I want to be awesome!!!" out of everywhere but the gameplay is basically your FC3 wrapped in some old time references. It looks like you should be running and gunning around Serious Sam-style but nope. Find some cover, spot your enemies, still the same. But level design does not really help with that. And the atmosphere. And the music. Everything wants the game to be tougher and cooler than it can actually be.After 30 minutes I wasn't really feeling like playing it anymore constantly thinking "give me back my Far Cry". Today I have tried it once again. And guess what - I've had to start it all over again. Why bother with all those "checkpoint, game saved"? It worked fine in FC3 last time I checked. And I'm not going through half an hour of that "tutorial" again. I'm noping out of it. Once again, everything is not that bad, even fine. Except for the gameplay. It doesn't fit at all.Mind that I don't really write revirews but this game made me do it. I just hope I can help some fellow gamer to save a few bucks. If you are not really sure then don't buy it. Forget it.P.S. To all those negative pseudo-reviews based solely on the presence of Uplay - stop being such crybabies and learn to PC or buy youself a console, just stop bothering people. Never had any troubles with it, always launches without asking any questions and works silently until you exit the game. Then it takes you just one click to close it.

content:
Posted: May 18, 2016
												This is basically a stand-alone expansion of Far Cry 3. Without revealing too much, this game is a parody of 80's popular culture that plays almost exactly like Far Cry 3. It is gorgeous, it is funny, and, most importantly, it is fun. I would even go so far as to argue that it has slightly better replay value than the original Far Cry 3.With the positives out of the way, here are the reasons why I am giving it the thumbs-down rating:While I would argue that it has slightly better replay value than the original Far Cry 3, I would also argue that the lack of content kinda negates the increased replayability to some degree.While I could tolerate the potential negatives of Uplay from a technical standpoint, the potential negatives from a business standpoint are enough by themselves for me to give a game a thumbs-down rating. What I'm talking about, to be more specific, is a Uplay feature unofficially referred to as "Steam Mode". When your Uplay library consists only of games bought through Steam, the store becomes inaccessible through the Uplay application. On top of that, many of the free games and demos/trials in the "Free Games" section of Uplay are removed. You have to make a purchase through Uplay in order to have these features reenabled. Sounds like an awfully slimy business tactic to me.The game itself is good. Great, even. But the decision I have to make here is whether or not I would recommend people to spend their hard-earned cash on this product. Unfortunately, my answer is no.

number of helpful: 4 of 9 people (44%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 7, 2014
												Farcry 3 alt. universe this is not. Sure, it comes with a full visual overhaul and a true 80s retro feel, but to call this a separate game would be too generous. The pacing is pretty bad, and they don't give you choice over how you level your player. The weapon selection is woefully limited and vehicles are pretty much pointless as your character runs at breakneck speed by default. The inclusion of the blood dragons was a nice touch, but I would have liked to see more of this, more character abilities, more challenge.The tongue-in-cheek humour is good (although it dries up a little outside of the first 30mins). There's some good retro gaming fan service and let's face it, shooting cyborgs in the face with a neon-coated bow from a faraway hill still ticks some boxes, but this game could've been much more. More outrageous, more idiotic, more creative...If after Farcry 3 is done you're left wanting, I'd pause for thought before diving into Blood Dragon as it might not fully scratch that itch.[5.5]

content:
Posted: December 5, 2013
												Before going in to this I thought the 80s sci-fi/action setting would be a great idea. However, this quickly wears off and you're stuck with a really dark (the sky is always red) environment and cheesy 80s one-liners wich get old really fast. I'm sure a lot of people will like this standalone expansion, but I was bored real fast. It just made me want to go back to the original Far Cry 3, with it's lush environments and blue skies. If the screenshots and the idea of constant 80s references and jokes don't turn you off you might have a great time though, because behind that lick of paint is the same Far Cry 3 game I enjoyed so much.The 80s throwback is a nice concept though, and I commend Ubisoft for trying.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												♥♥♥♥♥♥ game design doesn't not count as ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game design anymore if you include meta-commentary on the ♥♥♥♥♥iness of of said design elements (by making a series of VERY similar jokes) and their prevalence in other ♥♥♥♥♥ily designed games.The game suffers from the same problem as Snakes on a Plane and Grindhouse: if you are going to go for intentional silliness and retro parody, you need to go all the way, and here you don't see full commitment in every aspect of the game or its story. It's bog standard fake-open world stuff with repetitive combat clearly made for gamepad rather than mouse and keyboard, with a crazy 80's colour palette and frequent interruption to gameplay for some occasionally-not-crappy jokes, ham-fisted pop culture references and some mildly amusing cutscenes which are nowhere near as funny or clever as they could have been.Just watch the trailer. I wouldn't usually recommend that for a game but basically you get everything there is to get from the game in one hundredth of the time.

												This game had huge potential. It has an interesting setting and is making fun of the fps genre in general. content:
Posted: January 2, 2015
												This is how you make a true refreshing DLC. Far Cry 3 Blood Dragon uses the exact same gameplay and engine as Far Cry. Blood Dragon is a hilarious parody of everything in the 80's. This game is so hard to describe in a short review so watch this to get an idea of what the game is: 


YouTube™ Video: GameSpot Reviews - Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon 

			Views: 71,826		

			Kevin VanOrd braves the future world of the 1980's in this dragon-full DLC. Subscribe to GameSpot Reviews and never miss one!		

 Far Cry 3 Blood Dragon is more original and has much more and better content than most full prize video games. Far Cry 3 Blood Dragon's graphics are great and feel nothing like a Far Cry game. Besides gameplay, Far Cry 3 Blood Dragon is nothing like a Far Cry game. It has the funniest tutorial level ever... Because it mocks other tutorials. The main character Rex is hilarious, the gameplay is just as good as FC3's. the story is as good as any other dlc. Although it's cutscenes drag out too much and are very uninteresting. When the cutscees are on you can literally go, leave, make yourself lunch, take a shower, heck at least make a cold drink with ice. Because they take so long that i find myself ult tabbing whenever one is on and start watching other stuff until it's over. Their isn't enough autosaving points. As even when you hit checkpoints, if you quit you will have to restart the whole mission over and when you first start the game the first level is around an hour so don't start and quit. POSITIVES: great solid gameplay just like Far Cry 3's, unique graphics, hilarious comedy, lot's of content for a cheap priced DLC, better than lot's of full priced fps games around... also there are Dragon's with lazers...lot's of them. CONS: Cutscenes are too long and aren't skippable, Easy difficulty especially compared to FC3, VERDICT: A great DLC with lot's of content and a unique style. Easy to recommend

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 25, 2016
												The Short Version: widespread technical issues and incessant crashes render the game unplayable for many PC users.The Long Version: I jumped into the stormy, explosive waters of Far Cry right with its third installment, tasting the salt and bullet baffet for the first time with Far Cry 3.Blood Dragon's parent game was an interesting adventure and for the most part a fun ride, but both Far Cry 3 and this wacky incarnation of it seem to fail the most basic requirement of a PC game: ...You have to be able to play it.For that lofty goal to be achieved, it simply needs to be a thing that can run on the PC. Unfortunately, this is not the case for a great many PC users, myself included. When I first purchased Far Cry 3 (and later Blood Dragon), my computer met every single one of the minimum requirements to run it, but I haven't been able to get the game running. Technical support was of no help at all, and even after upgrading my computer (which I shouldn't have had to do, since I already met all the requirements), finally getting the game to work was an ordeal when I discovered that the game would crash on me almost every five minutes of play. Worse, it would often give me the Blue Screen of Death, forcing me to reboot. Even after trying everything I could from every advice, tip and tutorial I found online written for (and by) the many users who have gove through the exact same issues, the game would still crash. Since the game doesn't let you decide when you save your progress, most of my original run of Far Cry 3 was devoted to trying to get through the mandatory tutorial (that felt like it was 20-minutes long) in the beginning of the game, hoping it would not-crash long enough for me to get to a checkpoint and not have to start all over again when the game inevitably freezes my computer, forcing both a reboot on my part as well as a long wail of frustration, curled fingers reaching for the uncaring dark skies above.Blood Dragon, I was hoping, would be an improvement and the issues with its parent game (which were reported not only by yours truly, but a great many users who practically flooded not only the official game forums but a big chunk of other threads and discussion boards) - unfortunately, the game crashed right in the middle of the (again, mandatory) tutorial in the beginning, shortly after the opening scene and before I could get two minutes into the thing.I wish I had more to say about both games, but this abyssal experience has not allowed me much of an opportunity to actually play the game itself, and since it shouldn't be on me, the customer, to spend months of my life sifting through forums and struggling against the current, trying to get the game I paid money for to actually PLAY, I simply deleted both games from my computer and consoled myself only with the fact that I bought this one on sale. Still, it doesn't wash away the bad taste of the promise of a little video gamey fun being ruined by the video game not actually running.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 31, 2015
												First the rant, then the reviewI already have steam, I don't need uplay. This will be the last ubisoft game I ever buy since they have gone full retard and made their piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥launcher mandatory for their games.Do not support these greedy companies and their policies created by ♥♥♥♥ing morons who need to be hanged for not making this software optional.Now the reviewStep into the shoes of a cyber commando in an 80s movie vision of the future and fight other cybernetic bad guys. You gain better weapons and powerups along the way. It sounds like any other shooter but it is very story driven and a very unique experience from that aspect.The world around you has character that contributes heavily to the experience. There are nerdy scientists you have to save, mutated animals that pose a threat in the wilderness and under water. The weapons have a sci fi theme, rather than being based too much on real world weapons. The pistol is based on Robocop's side arm, for exampleAlso like other far cry games, how you achieve your objective is basically a choice between killing your opponents stealthily or with guns blazing. You can sum up the gameplay as a reskinned Far Cry 3 without the gathering and crafting elements, but I personally found Blood Dragon to be the better of the two experiences. Instead of motion captured acting cinematic cutscenes, you get pixely looking montages that are very entertaining to watch. The dialog of all the main characters are written by people who must have watched a lot of those 80s sci-fi b movies. It's a shorter game but it's not expensive and well worth the low price, however I can only recommend it on PS3 or Xbox360, to avoid the uplay nonsense

content:
Posted: September 11, 2014
 TL;DR Unless you want a game just because is more or less a basic 1980s reference, move on, there are far better and longer games for under $10. It's standard and stale FPS gameplay with neon and ♥♥♥♥♥♥ jokes. The Good. +The game play is smooth, and aside from cutscenes (which don't really obstruct gameplay) and loading you'll spend your time wandering the black-and-neon wastes.+The game engine itself feels fluent and all cutscenes are skippable.+The sniper rifle is useful, with or without any attachments.  Not OP at all. >+Blowing people up with the sniper is  satisfying  , for a short period anyway.+Power Core (Power on Uplay?) is actually pretty good.+Blood Dragon Main theme is OK.+You can still drive the large utility trucks atleast once in the game, it never forces you to, but you can do it.+If you look for it you can find a mantaray in the water, nothing too special but it was cool seing something other than a shark, eal or fish.  The Bad. -Game is supposed to have a stupid atmostphere, but it just ends up being bad.-It is WAY too short even on hard, even after collecting EVERYTHING. It's under 4 hours. I've beaten  it twice already and screwed around in the empty world.-The pistol, while probably supposed to be a reference to the Robocop pistol, is, unlike it's original, useless. Looks are decieving.-The shotgun doesn't work like you would expect when it's in quad. It takes 3-5 shells to kill a heavy on single, 4 on double, and a total of 8 on quad. How does that work? It's because it normally takes an average of 4, but the game most likely doesn't count all 4 shells hitting when your in quad. The fire attachment feels OK and it works, until you realize it isn't just fire. It explodes too, which is most likely going to shred you too when your using a shotgun at close range, it also explodes grass, which lights everything on fire. Which includes you, because there is grass everywhere. Plus fire is useless on Blood "Dragons."-I know the point of the game is to be all-on-you, but if your going to have friendly AI, don't make them ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. I watched a couple jeeps of scientists crash into the same Blood "Dragon" at the same spot.-Blood Dragons are clearly Dinosaurs.>-This isn't Star Trek, and that isn't a dog with a cone on it's head.>-How hard is it to tell a Dinosaur from a Dragon? It's not even a European Dragon/Wyvern.-The Terror 4000.-The bow is absolute crap, and I don't know why anyone though it was a good idea. ♥♥♥♥ing Crysis 3 and Far Cry 3 useless♥♥♥♥♥♥ that's why.-Remember death from above? How about finishing 1/2 the game never using ammo? Sound fun? It's not. It's OP and is even worse when you get auto pilfer. Someone tell me why I need a gun again.-The Pin Cussion (CRT) Shader gets really anoying after about an hour in game, If it needs to be there, it could have atleast had been better.-Minor, but there is no photo mode, there's some really cool stuff to see, If only there wasn't a GUI and the shaders from the GUI in the way.-Ending sequence is BS, and you can't die.-Minor: They missed the opertunity to reference Atari's Battlezone and put a castle in the background and send missiles at you when you try to go to it.-  The Kill Star is terrible VS the Terror or Sniper. -  You don't get to kill sloan. -  Ending BS cutscene is BS. -Flamer is still terrible.-Fazetron is Ok, I'm Ok with that, and I am not OK with that.>-Fazetron on lasers is actually pretty bad, and not worth the effort. Just skip it.-Cutscenes are based on the Ninja Giaden style, but if you never played that they just end up looking like slideshows. Why they weren't Sega-CD-like-FMV style beats me, I'd expect that to be wider known. They even go as far to make the still sprites slide across the scene in some cases.-You still can't go onto Sloan's island or the bridge even after the game is fully complete.-Why the ♥♥♥♥ would anyone kill 25 Blood Dragons?-Soundtrack does not contain any mitch murder or Kavinsky>-Uplay doesn't let you get the song from the fights leading up to the Kill Star, but gives you sloan's assault instead.-Why do you keep giving me C400, let alone C4, if  I will NEVER USE IT.-Molotox tends  not to light♥♥♥♥♥♥on fire, let alone doing damage to anything other than you.-Mission abandoned due to walking too far to the left, or any direction for tha matter.-Cyber Soldiers voice isn't irony or nostalgia, it's just anoying.-Location isn't new, if you didn't know it't just FC3's second island burned and covered in Noble gas lights.-Jeeps without guns. Everywhere.-Cyber Soldiers drop weapons and they decintegrate, and no matter what they had tend to give you Fazetron ammo anyway.-I had to be on hard to ever have a shark not ignore me.-Can my Blood Dinosaurs do something toehr than explode when killed?-Saving hostages that run into fire, explosions or my sniper rifle is BS-The limit for cyber hearts is 99. You'll collect around 230 ingame if your like me (collectively before and after they take everythingaway), using only ~32 in the entire game.-The D20, when the ♥♥♥♥ would I ever use that.-Sniper is OP on max upgrades.  Joke points  -The TVs don't have descriptions, unlike the VHS tapes which are based off real movies.-There is no VHS player to use any of the VHS tapes, 2007 really was hell.-TVs under water.-Where is my bike?-Blue goo.-You can♥♥♥♥♥♥off animals and slow them down with D20s.-Stop putting bow ammo everywhere, it's useless.+Mmmm. Noble lights.

content:
Posted: September 14, 2014
												If there's one thing this game is, it's thurough. Completely thurough with it's cheesy 80's theme, but often to a fault.For example, purposfully covering your view with scanlines and tint to bring back crappy 80's resolution doesn't mean said scanlines and tint won't make it hard to see what the christ is going on throughout the entire christing game!Far Cry 3's use of its engine was magnificant! But it wasn't designed as an over the top shooter. It was about planning, taking it slow, and methodically toppeling your foes' instalments. This game on the other hand is about action! Lots of action! Over the top action! But Far Cry 3's engine just doens't support it. Oh, Blood Dragon will tell you that stealth is still an option, but stealth requires precision and clarity, two things which this game's visuals (while awesome) utterly preclude.If you're more into 80's cheese than I am, you might be able to look past that. But all that deliberatily crappy grunge just gets in the way of the mechanics, the clarity and the conveyance.Yes, it's completely faithful to it's 80's theme, but I personally am reminded why it's a good job it's not the 80's anymore.Not to mention horrible horrible Uplay. No Ubisoft! I don't want to wait five minutes for an update EVERY SINGLE TIME I WANT TO PLAY!!

content:
Posted: December 9, 2014
												A fun, doesn't-take-it-self-too-seriously standalone mod/expansion to FarCry 3. Takes all the greatest tropes from classic 80's action films as well as conventions from traditional FPS' (health packs, carry more than 3 weapons, etc.) and immerses you in a gritty, retro world with modern polish.Despite this, I experienced a game breaking bug that prevented the game from saving any of my progress. Tried a few different workarounds without success.The game is ~9 hours; maybe one day I'll revisit it and/or marathon though the game.

content:
Posted: May 5, 2013
												Selling five times what Ubi expected, Blood Dragon is a breath of fresh air in an otherwise stale lineup of new shooters. It has that feeling of those 00's era shooters like Unreal II where it has just the right mixture of story and gameplay without feeling like a movie or an arena shooter. It's a reminder that games should be entertaining. It's also how DLC should be done. It's a joke game appealing to a niche market and as such it's Bioshock Infinitely better than a AAA game trying to appeal to everyone.

content:
Posted: May 2, 2013
												What this game does best is cultivate an image for itself through the art and the soundtrack. It looks like it was made from care and a love for '80s macho ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t and antique synthpop. The mechanics are all fine and the shooty action is pretty good, but about somewhere after hour two is when the game starts repeating itself, and the game gets worse in writing and missions as it goes on, opting for HA HA, 80s TROPES. (It ends with a turret section with a meme in it, which I consider to be a middle finger-worthy act.) The same one-liners, the same types of extracurricular mission, the same kind of thing I imagine is in Far Cry 3 but cut down a bit. This is triple-A gaming trying to play like an indie, but what happens is that due to the heightened and faster production cycle, the game comes off looking good but feeling anemic, padded, and slightly wilted. So it's all right, but I'd recommend the soundtrack over this.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 23, 2014
												Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon is a perfect, bite-sized serving of of gaming goodness. It plays like a condensed version of a typical Far Cry game, but with a heaping helping of insane humor and crazy weaponry. The main campaign doesn't last long, only clocking in at about 5 hours, but the content it contains is perfectly tuned to be a fun and polished as possible. The humorous writing is spot-on and each level gives you something unique and fun to do. Outside of the main levels, Blood Dragon gives itself some replay value with side quests and collectables for you to tackle, which is satisfying and adds another 6-ish hours to the game. This game is a good value for its price point and is sure to please.

content:
Posted: May 4, 2013
												This is what I thought games in the future would look like when I was a kid in the 80s. The great part about this game is that it's not a parody of the 80s - it is a game that seemingly was designed in 1986 and sat in a jar somewhere for 25+ years. From the music, to the dialog this very well could have been be released for the Commodore 64 (minus the awesome graphics). If you don't like this game you're probably a socalist pig and I hope you die.

content:
Posted: July 5, 2015
												One of the best games I have ever Played.... This is second to that of Halo reach and FarCry Instincts Preditor. *WARNING* Uplay is a ♥♥♥♥♥ to get it to work... If you manage it though, you'll see that this game is almost unmatched.Pros:*Great Graphics - 7/10*Funny and unique characters that make the game feel finished and detailed - 9/10*Runs very well on my computer(I have a little above adverage laptop) - 7.5/10*The soundtrack Amazing - 10/10*Great Animations, Really fluid - 8.5/10*A good, 20 hours of gameplay if you take your time, no rush 7/10*Humour - 9/11*Running speed - 10/10*Swimming speed - 10/10*Take no fall damage because your a cyborg - 10/10*Murder everything you see - 6,000,000/10   <---Jew joke *Blood dragons shoot red kamehameha waves at you when they get angry. - 8/10*Best weapon in my opinion is the shotgun and/or the knife. - 10/10Cons:     @~10 = really bad~@     @~1 = No Big Deal~@*Fps drops a tad bit around building - 4/10*Once you enter a missions sphere of influence, you are locked to that mission, leaving the mission area makes you fail the mission and have to restart. There is no way to leave a mission once you start.  - 8/10*The Animals are pretty useless and ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. - 7/10*There is no way to attack sharks underwater until they attack you - 6/10*If you just rush through the missions and speed run the game, you WON'T have fun. You need to make sure to take garrisons - 6/10*Uplay might not work on some Computers, I know a bunch of people hate it. I got it to work 2 days after i bought it, so I guess it's okay but not great so i'll give it a... - 8/10*Not too short, but not nearly as long as a standalone should be. They should have added 7 more enemy garrisons because that would be 20 that you have to take over, just my opinion. - 2/10*No way to listen to the wicked soundtrack ingame, other than by waiting for it to play. - 3/10*The bow is sort of useless, and engaging the enemy from a distance is pointless since you can murder them with your smg up close or just use a gernade. - 4/10*Driving is useless because you can run just about as fast and be able to jump and strafe. - 2/10I am getting a cool canvas print out of Rex Power Colt....http://www.bonanza.com/listings/Far-Cry-3-Blood-Dragon-Rex-Power-Colt-Game-Art-30x20-Framed-Canvas-Print/266574234I really like this game..... :D

content:

												Holy♥♥♥♥♥♥this game is awesome. The music, the humor, the visuals, and of course more of Far Cry 3's fluid and immersive gameplay, are all perfect and fitting. The game is a humorous homage to 1980s sci-fi cyberpunk and action films and it's brutally funny. The story itself is very short (only a couple hours) and rarely do I find myself playing a game beyond its narrative elements, however the setting, weapons and continuous humor are just so incredibly unique that it's too much fun to even repetitively capture garrisons. 9/10

content:
Posted: May 10, 2013
												In similar ways that I enjoyed Saint's Row The Third, Just Cause 2, Warframe, and of course Far Cry 3, Blood Dragon is a fantastic game. The gameplay/combat is that of FC3, which is good. For everything else, it draws from those games I just listed. The graphics/art style, the tribute to classic 80s movies and franchises, and amazing music, and the humor are all so perfect for people like me. This game is what Duke Nukem should have been. There are talks of a sequel and perhaps this becoming a series of its own, and if so, that official announcement will be a great day for me. While the game can be short, it'll still get you a good 7-8 hours, and for $15, that is an amazing price. 4.5/5

content:
Posted: August 4, 2014
												Blood Dragon is actually a really fun game. Really easy but fun. Granted the price may be a bit steep since theres really not enough in the game to really captivate you for 15 hours. The graphics are pretty good, I cant really make a huge complaint on them concidering the game is done in a retro 80's art style. The one liners just keep coming as you play the game too so dont think he says the same thing all the time. If you liked the gameplay of Far Cry 3 then this is a cakewalk since, as stated on the store page, it is built off of Far Cry 3 but does not require the base game. The storyline is pretty much what you'd expect out of an 80's themed sci-fi shoot em up game. Worlds been through nuclear war, big red shield in the atmosphere protecting the people from harmful cosmic radiation. Corperations control the planet and fight for control yadayadayada. All in all I do recommend this game to people who find that it perks their interest but I also strongly encourage you to wait until it goes on sale because the price does not match the amount of content offered.

												Far Cry 3 : Blood Dragon is a very creative,futuristic game that has bunch of joke's and that Far Cry 3 feel.I would defineatly recommend this game to big fans of Far Cry 3 like me.Pros :+ Fun to play+ Huge world to explore+ You have two ways of playing : silently or Rambo style+ It haves retro graphics which are absolutely beutiful+ Can run on low pc's Cons :- The game is really short,it gets repetetive after 20 hoursAt the end of the day Far Cry 3 : Blood Dragon is a pretty fun game to play,i liked it as a big fan of Far Cry 3.But as i said the game is really short but i don't regret buying it since it was a fun adventure. :D7.5/10 - A fun little game,but gets repetetive after you finish the story and eliminate all the outpost's

												This is by far one of the funniest games I've ever played. Being a kid that grew up in the 21st century, I don't get much of the references. But I laughed my♥♥♥♥♥off the whole way through. The cutscenes bring me back to when I played nothing but retro games for about a year or two. Believe me or not, the plot seems more grounded than Far Cry 3's.Buy the Call of Juarez Gunslinger + Far Cry 3 - Blood Dragon pack for the best story telling experience you've had in video games."He said 'Blow Me', so I did" - Rex Power Colt after blowing up an enemy.

Posted: January 21, 2016
												Love love love this game. I love the 80's reference, the mood and action. All the guns are over powered (in a good way) and the one liners are great. +80's aestheticsone linersExplosionsSolid gameplay-The stealth didn't get the same shot in the arm that the guns didSometimes the neon makes it hard to seeBe aware you will need Uplay, so you'll have to log in and start it each time. For many this is a deal breaker, for me, I don't really care. It has an offline mode, so you don't need to worry about being online. Also, if you don't have Far Cry 3, the game will still work.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 23, 2016
												I had a ton of fun playing this game. Far Cry 3 really nailed the open-world FPS thing for me, and Blood Dragon just builds on what I enjoyed about the original. Blood Dragon takes the core mechanics and simplifies them, so all you need to worry about is enjoying the♥♥♥♥♥kicking and hilarious cheesy 80's action movie dialogue. You feel incredibly powerful as you mow down slews of enemies, and fighting the blood dragons themselves is pretty awesome. If you enjoy FC3 and want to play it again in a ridiculous 80's style, then buy this immediately! Well worth it at $15.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 18, 2016
												The gameplay is basically the same as FC3, but the setting is even prettier. It is more story-oriented, but maybe that's because I didn't bother too much with sidequests (liberated only 3 out of 12 camps), the whole thing took me about 10 hours. But you can still "keep killing" if you want after that. Very funny, and with lots of mayhem. I especially enjoyed fighting the "running dead" to get the star, and riding a very content blood dragon.Conclusion: Short but loads of fun!
